April 2?, 1951
Mr. A. Frank Reel
American Federation of Radio Artists
15 West 44th Street
New York IS, New York
Dear Mr. Reel:
First of all may I extend our sincerest thanks to
you for AFRA*s permission to use the WLS series,"The New
World of Atomic Energy‚Äù. I hagge delayed writing you because
I knew there was another problem to present to you before
we could begin distribution of the series.
There is no problem with our regular broadcast stations.
They will broadcast the programs one-time and send the tapes
on immediately, since we operate on a rather tight schedule.
The problem arises with the stations which do in-school
broadcasting. All of our programs are sent out on magnetic
tape. It is our practice to have the school stations dub their
own copies of programs. This enables them to fit the programs
into their complicated schedules, which are made up as much as
a semester in advance. It is my proposal that all stations
using the series in this way fill in the enclosed form which
we will retain on file here at our network headquarters. The
question is, of course, is this method satisfactory to AFRA?
No tapes of this series have been sent out as yet, nor
will they be until we hear from you.
One additional question, does AFRA desire clee3rance
credit on transcriptions used in this manner? We would be
happy to do so if that is your wish.
As you indicate, we will omit station VNYC from our
schedule.
We undoubtedly will have occasion to trouble you with
our problems again in the future. I am very appreciative of
AFRA*s goals. I was a member of the New York Local for a short
period before the last war. I can assure you that the NAEB
is most anxious to cooperate in every possible way.
Again our thanks for your splendid cooperation.
Cordially,
RLR:bgm
Richard L. Rider
Manager
NAEB Tape Network
